hero.title: Decentralised naming for wallets, websites, & more.

portableUsername.title: Your web3 username
portableUsername.text: No more sandboxed usernames. Own your username, store an avatar and other profile data, and use it across services.

cryptocurrencies.title: One Name For All of Your Addresses
cryptocurrencies.text: No more copying and pasting long addresses. Use your POWNS name to store all of your addresses and receive any cryptocurrency, token, or NFT.

statistics.title: POWNS is the most widely integrated blockchain naming standard on EthereumPoW.

decentralisedWebsites.title: Decentralised Websites
decentralisedWebsites.text: Launch censorship-resistant decentralised websites with POWNS. Upload your website to IPFS and access it with your POWNS name.

dns.title: Use Traditional Domains
dns.text1: The native name suffix for POWNS is .ethw, which has the full security benefits of being blockchain-native.
dns.text2: You can also use POWNS with DNS names you already own. POWNS supports most DNS names, including:

additionalFeatures.title: Additional Features
additionalFeatures.recordType: Create your projectâ€™s own record type.
additionalFeatures.textRecord: Attach profile information to your POWNS name with text records.
additionalFeatures.subDomains: Create POWNS subdomains as usernames for your project.
additionalFeatures.dns: Store and serve traditional DNS records with certain names.
additionalFeatures.tor: Use POWNS to more easily access Tor .onion hidden services.

about.hero: POWNS Domains is an open source blockchain-based naming protocol.

aboutDNS.title: About POWNS
aboutDNS.text: POWNS forked from LNS onto EthereumPoW with a focus on decentralization, inexpensive fees, and robust tokenomics. POWNS development is led by mainnet_pat and is a public good, a basic piece of Internet infrastructure that belongs to the community. We welcome all feedback and contributions!
aboutDNS.support: We have received generous financial support from:
aboutDNS.support2: Representatives of POWNS participate in the greater Internet community:

root.title: Managing the POWNS root
root.text: To facilitate the possibility of upgrades and maintenance, the POWNS root is controlled by a four of seven multisig, with members of related projects as keyholders. In the long term, we would like the root multisig to be replaced by some form of distributed decision making process, as such systems become available.
